summary:
18. Emphasizes there can be no military solution to the conflict, welcomes commitment to talks, and urges parties to finalize preparations.

19. Welcomes the Joint Communiqu√© between the Government of Sudan and the UN on humanitarian activities.

20. Emphasizes the need for developmental initiatives to bring peace dividends.

21. Requests the Secretary-General to report to the Council every 90 days on progress and obstacles.

22. Demands parties fulfill international obligations and commitments.

23. Recalls reports on the security of civilians in eastern Chad and north-eastern Central African Republic.

24. Emphasizes determination to improve the situation in Darfur.

25. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
